name: Scenario: As a user, I should be able to verify that the user can click on the drop-down and search by hitting the key for the first letter of the slice.

Scenario: As a registered user, I should be able to verify the visibility of `Search Namespaces` input field and `Add to slice` button and `Selected Namespaces` field along with the selected namespace being displayed.
Scenario: As a registered user, I should be not be able to verify that the user can enter only values ranging from 2-32

Scenario: As a registered user, I should be able to verify the visibility of slice resource table having field Slice Name, No. of Pods, CPU, Memory, Ephemeral Storage if slices available and empty slice message to direct user to onboard namespace
Scenario: As a registered user, I should be able to validate the visibility of 3 tab menu with navigation to the step-2 screeen and step 2 being active one.
Scenario: As a registered user, I should be able to see About Us information: Company Details
Scenario: As a registered user, I should be able to verify that the slice admin can enter either limits or requests for raising alerts at the slice level
Scenario: As a registered user, I should be able to view Local Gateway Config when cliked on any displayed cluster.
Scenario: As a registered user, I should be able to filter the columns inside 'Show Columns' modal, search the column parameter, and Hide / Show all columns at once
Scenario: As a registered user, I should be able to verify the visibility of cluster data table including `Clusters`, `Deployment Location` and `Cloud Type` in the collapsable dropdown table.
Scenario: As a registered user, I should be able to verify the visibility of “Code Preview” section along with the utility icons on the far right header of “Code Preview” and its utilities.
Scenario: As a registered user, I should be able to open up a pop up modal and close the code preview window section under install helm screen
Scenario: As a registered user, I should be able to verify the visibility of `slice and namespaces` table with `slice name, namespaces and description.`
Scenario: As a registered user, I should be able to verify the visibility of `slice` table with `slice name, namespaces, isolation, allowed namespaces and description.`

Scenario: As a registered user, I should be able to validate the visibility of 3 tab menu with step 3 being active one and rest of the steps with completed tag along with “Slices and Namespaces” table and its selected slice data along with `Allowed Namespaces`, `DESCRIPTION` and `ISOLATE NAMESPACE` field.
Scenario: As a registered user, I should be able to verify that the user cannot go to Step 3 if there are any namespaces with enforcement enabled but no limits are entered
Scenario: As a user, I should be able to verify that the user can maximize/minimize the Kubernetes Dashboard frame
Scenario: As a registered user, I should be able to hide and toggle the visibility of particular column
Scenario: As a registered user, I should be able to view the missing cluster message when there are no clusters inside current namespace.
Scenario: As a user, I should be able to update the period parameter under service dependency graph
Scenario: As a registered user, I should be able to verify that that the Slice Admin can set limits only at the slice level (without enforcement) and get alerts when they are hit
Scenario: As a registered user, I should be able to view all the slice details on the top of the table.
Scenario: As a registered user, I should be able to verify the visibility of `Done` button and navigation to the fallback page when clicked on it.
Scenario: As a registered user, I should be able to click on the recently createad slice and view Cluster Name, Slice Gateway and App Pods.
Scenario: As a registered user, I should be able to validate the navigation to isolate namespaces page when clicked on `Manage Namespace -> Isolate` menu .
Scenario: As an operator, I should be able to view the 'Add Slice' button at the bottom of the screen or after Table ( if it exists )
Scenario: As a user, I should be able to verify visibility of toggle button in the top right corner of topological view.
Scenario: As a registered user, I should be able to verify the Next button is disabled until the user applies the YAML.
Scenario: As a registered user, I should be able to verify that the Slice Admin can click on `Next` to go to Step 2
Scenario: As a user, I should be able to verify that the Kubernetes dashboard opens as an iframe within the Avesha KubeSlice Manager when the user clicks on ‘View Dashboard’
Scenario: As a user, I should be able to view the in-detail information of the created slice inside slice configuration tab.
Scenario: As a user, I should be able to verify the functionality of changing the graph type(line or area) and validate the graphs are being displayed accordingly.
Scenario: As a registered user, I should be able to filter the table using 'Filter' options and typing in the value under filter value
Scenario: As a user, I should not be able to view the Sankey Graph on invalid cluster and slice data

Scenario: As a user, I should be able to view  the cluster table having fields `Cluster Name, Cloud Name, Capacity, Kubernetes dasboard` and slice selection field in the top right corner of the table.
Scenario: As a registered user, I should be able to verify that slices with enabled enforcement are depicted with a green dot.
Scenario: As a registered user, I should be able to view register cluster button on the initial screen.
Scenario: As a user, I should be able to verify the site location name of the connected clusters of a slice when hovered over it the map.

Scenario: As a registered user, I should be able to verify that  the Slice Admin enters a limit that is lesser than the usage, the Slice Admin is shown a popup that warns them about the impact it will have
Scenario: As a user, I should be able to verify the visibility of slice selection bar in the top right corner of the map.
Scenario: As a registered user, I should be able to verify the visibility of `Done` button and navigation to the fallback page when clicked on it.
Scenario: As a registered user, I should be able to verify  the namespace section is shown in Step 2
Scenario: As a registered user, I should be able to view Gateway Details when cliked on any displayed cluster.
Scenario: As a user, I should be able to update the custom range period parameter under service dependency graph
Scenario: As a user, I should be able to validate the functionality to choose a anchor cluster from the cluster selection field for the metrics chart.
Scenario: As a registered user, I should be able to create new cluster with the cluster details.
Scenario: As non registered user, I should not be able to log in successfully
Scenario: As a registered user, I should be able to validate the visibility of `Add Namespace` table including `Slice Name` and `Description`.
Scenario: As a user, I should be able to verify navigating to topology view when clicked on Metrics tab as default.
Scenario: As a registered user, I should be able to view Remote Gateway Config when cliked on any displayed cluster.
Clearing up the clusters created during the execution of test cases which failed to be cleared up due to test failure (if exist any) !
Scenario: As a registered user, I should be able to verify the visibility of `Namespaces` table with `namespaces` and `clusters` when clicked on `View all` of the namespace field in slice table.
Scenario: As a registered user, I should be able to validate the visibility of slice and namespaces table that includes `Selected Slice` and `Isolate Namespaces`.
Scenario: As a registered user, I should be able to verify that the slice admin can search through the list of namespaces by searching by namespace or cluster
Scenario: As a user, I should be able to verify that when a specific slice is selected from the slice dropdown, only clusters attached to that slice are shown in the map.
Scenario: As a user, I should be able to Verify that legends are depicted correctly for the clusters (Clouds, Edge, Data Centers).
Scenario: As a registered user, I should be able to verify the isolation enabled and the seleted namespaces via yaml code in the code editor.
Scenario: As a registered user, I should also be able to filter out the existing clusters as per the available set of parameters on filter option
Scenario: As a registered user, I should be able to verify that cluster name is also shown along with each namespace
Scenario: As a user, I should be able to update the events bar under service dependency graph
Scenario: As a registered user, I should be able to verify that the Pod Limit field is mandatory and the Slice Admin cannot proceed to Step 2 without entering the Pod Limit
Scenario: As a registered user, I should be not be able to create new cluster without the cluster name.
Scenario: As a user, I should be able to validate the slice configuration message and download file input field
Scenario: As a registered user, I should be able to validate the namespace and cluster data of the selected slice as in step 1.
Scenario: As a registered user, I should be able to validate the namespace and cluster data of the selected slice as in step 1.
Scenario: As a user, I should be able to verify that the user can close the Kubernetes dashboard to come back to the Clusters tab
Scenario: As an operator, I should be able to verify that the user cannot connect more clusters than the maxclusters defined to the slice
Scenario: As a user, I should be able to verify the no graphs message `There are no graphs to show. Select a cluster` when no cluster is selected in initial screen.

Scenario: As a registered user, I should be able to verify that when a slice admin selects a slice without quotas set `Add Resource Quotas` button is visible and `Edit Resource Quotas` is visible when quotas are set
Scenario: As a user, I should not be able to login with an empty credentials
Clearing up the slices created during the execution of test cases which failed to be cleared up due to test failure (if exist any) !
Scenario: As a user, I should be able to switch to different cluster and see different data on node utilization
Scenario: As a registered user, I should be able to filter the table using 'Filter' options and altering the operator parameter
Scenario: As a user, I should be able to view the Sankey Graph on valid cluster and slice data
Scenario: As a registered user, I should be able to verify the selected namespaces being displayed in the `Selected Allowed Namespaces` field.
Scenario: As a user, I should be able to verify that the default graph type is `Line`.

Scenario: As a registered user, I should be able to verify that the Slice Admin can set any quota/combination of quotas for the requests or limits for CPU, memory and ephemeral storage and the pod limit

Scenario: As a user, I should be able to verify that the user can select a Slice from the dropdown and the clusters that are a part of only that slice are shown in the Topology, along with the latency info.
Scenario: As a registered user, I should be able to verify the visibility of `Add Namespaces` when clicked on any slice.
Scenario: As a registered user, I should be able to view and download the yaml file necessary for heml installation through install helm screen

Scenario: As a registered user, I should be able to validate the visibility of slice table containing `slice name, allowed namespaces, description and isolated namespaces` and the `Apply Yaml Button`.
Scenario: As a user, I should be able to Verify that the user can toggle between the Chart view and the Topology view with the same slice selection.
Scenario: As a registered user, I should be able to verify the visibility of cluster data table including `Clusters`, `Deployment Location` and `Cloud Type` in the collapsable dropdown table.
Scenario: As a user, I should be able to verify that the user can select the time they want to view the latency and that the accurate latency is displayed.
Scenario: As a registered user, I should be able to verify the `No namespace selected` message when there is no any namespace selected
Scenario: As a registered user,  I should be able to redirect to the connect cluster landing page when clicked on the cancel button.
Scenario: As a registered user, I should be not be able to create new cluster without the network interface.
Scenario: As a registered user, I should be able to verify the slice and namespace quotas the Slice Admin applied are shown.
Scenario: As an operator, I should be able to able to connect cluster after creating a slice with the available cluster.
Scenario: As a registered user, I should be not be able to create new slice without the Slice QOS Desc Class.
Scenario: As an operator, I should be able to able to verify that the slice creation page has field for maxclusters.
Scenario: As a user, I should be able to verify the visibility of metrics chart with respect to latency and time(UTC) on a valid cluster.
Scenario: As a user, I should be able to verify that the clusters connected to the particular slice are only shown when user selects a slice from the dropdown.
Scenario: As a registered user, I should be able to validate the visibility of slice table including `Slice Name` and `Description`.
Scenario: As a registered user, I should be able to filter the data under service discovery table using ASC and DESC options
Scenario: As a user, I should be able to verify navigating to chart view when clicked on Metrics tab and clicked the chart view toggle button.
Scenario: As a registered user, I should be not be able to create new slice without the Slice QOS Profile Priority.
Scenario: As registered administrator, I should be able to view the search bar and service discovery button
Scenario: As a registered user, I should be able to verify that the user can go to Step 3 by clicking on Next
Scenario: As a registered user, I should be able to view cluster details table when cluster is present and no cluster message when in initial register cluster screen when no cluster present.
Scenario: As a registered user, I should be able to verify the the Slice Admin can view the quotas set at the slice and namespaces for which enforcement has been enabled

Scenario: As a registered user, I should be able to verify that Pod limit is mandatory and that the user cannot proceed to Step 3 without entering the Pod limits for the namespaces where enforcement is enabled
Scenario: As a registered administrator, I should also be able to create 2 slices with same subnet IP
Scenario: As a registered user, I should be able to validate the visibility of `Isolate Namespaces, Step-1` screen
Scenario: As a user, I should be able to view all the slices with detail if I click on Topology > Slice
Scenario: Verification of clusters, Slice, nodes, Namespace and services widgets available with count and status
Scenario: As a user, I should be able to verify that the registered clusters are shown in the cluster table.
Scenario: As a registered user, I should be able to view the details of created clusters under finalize screen
Scenario: As a registered user, I should be able to verify the visibility of `Add Namespaces` when clicked on any slice.

Scenario: As a registered user, I should be able to verify that that the Slice Admin can delete all slices values at once, if enforcement is enabled on any of the namespaces, then the user is asked for confirmation
Scenario: As a registered user, I should be not be able to create new slice without the Slice Bandwidth Ceiling.
Scenario: As a registered user, I should be able to verify the visibility of Namespace popup modal and the data inside the modal
Scenario: As a registered user, I should be able to verify the visibility of `Namespaces` table with `namespaces` and `clusters` when clicked on `View all` of the namespace field in slice table.
Scenario: As a registered user, I should be able to view the missing cluster note inside install helm screen when there are no clusters in current namespace.
Scenario: As a registered user, I should be able to validate the visibility of 3 tab menu with step 2 being active one and the slice name as selected from the previous step.

Scenario: As a registered user, I should be able to verify that the quotas for the namespaces can only be entered when Enforcement is enabled (toggle turned ON),  irrespective of parameters set at the Slice level
Scenario: As a registered user, I should be able to verify that that the Slice Admin can update the limits
Scenario: As an operator, I should be able to view the slice information table if any data pre exists and slice absence message if data doesn't pre exist
Scenario: As a registered user, I should be able to view the cluster details inside the table under install helm screen and copy the helm commands.

Scenario: As a registered user, I should be able to verify when the Slice Admin clicks on Apply YAML, there is a popup to show that the changes have been applied (or not) and then the ‘Next’ button is enabled.
Scenario: As a registered user, I should be not be able to create new cluster without the Slice Name.
Scenario: As a registered user, I should be able to verify that the user-defined pod limit is below the current pod count, the usage is highlighted in red
Scenario: As a registered user, I should be able to verify that that the Steps on the top of the page are not clickable

Scenario: As a registered user, I should be able to validate the visibility of 3 tab menu with step 3 being active one and rest of the steps with completed tag along with “Slices and Namespaces” table and its selected slice data along with Namespaces field from where we can view the applied namespaces data.
Scenario: As an operator, I should be able to able to view the slice details with the connected clusters.
Scenario: As a registered user, I should be able to verify that the quotas hit are highlighted in red at the slice level, and the limits are shown as well.
Scenario: As a registered user, I should be able to view the service discovery table and the data inside the table under 'Slices' menu
Scenario: As a user, I should be able to Verify that the user can toggle between the Chart view and the Topology view with the same slice selection.
Scenario: As a registered user, I should be able to verify that if the quotas are set the values look like 230/400.
Scenario: As a registered user, I should be able to see the list of slices under Connect > Slices and slice absent message if we don't have any slices.
Scenario: As a user, I should be able to verify the visibility of slice deployment map under Dashboard → Deployment Map
Scenario: As a registered user, I should be able to verify that the namespaces are sorted
Scenario: As a user, I should be able to verify the functionality of changing the graph type(line or area) and validate the graphs are being displayed accordingly..
Scenario: As a registered user, As a registered user, I should be not be able to create new slice without the Slice Subnet.

Scenario: As a registered user, I should be able to verify that the Slice admins can define the quotas at the slice level for no of pods, CPU limit and request, Memory limit, and Request, Ephemeral Storage limit and request
Scenario: As a registered user, I should be able to verify that the user can go to Step 1 by clicking on Previous
Scenario: As a user, I should be able to verify that the user can choose the views - All, North America, Europe, default view is `All`.
Scenario: As a registered user, I should be able to validate the navigation to manage namespaces page when clicked on `Manage Namespace` menu .
Scenario: As a user, I should be able to download the yaml file of the slice configuration data
Scenario: As a registered user, I should be able to verify the namespace sameness via yaml code in the code editor.
Scenario: As a registered user, I should be able to verify the visibility of “Apply YAML” button and its function to apply YAML for adding namespaces on the slice.
Scenario: As an operator, I should be able to able to create slice from "Enter Slice Details" screen with correct information.
Scenario: As a registered user, I should be able to verify that the slice admin can select a slice and click on `Edit Resource Quota` to go to Step 1
Scenario: As a registered user, I should be able to verify that the YAML can be downloaded.
Scenario: As a registered user, I should be able to verify that the slice admin can update the set quotas for the naemspaces
Scenario: As a registered user, I should be able to verify the visibility of “Code Preview” section along with the utility icons on the far right header of “Code Preview” and its utilities.
Scenario: As a user, I should be able to verify that the capacity graph is a snapshot of the real-time graph.
Scenario: As a registered user, I should be able to verify the visibility of search field and its functionality to search the slice
Scenario: As a registered user, I should be able to verify the user can download the YAML from here as well.
Scenario: As a user, I should be able to navigate to the cluster page when clicked on Dashboard -> Clusters
Scenario: As a registered user, I should be able to view the missing cluster note inside cluster yaml screen when there are no clusters in current namespace.
Scenario: As a registered user, I should be able to verify that the usage is always shown for all the slices and namespaces even if quotas are not set.
Scenario: As a user, I should be able to verify that the user can select other durations to view the line charts for (1hr, 3hr, 5hr, 1d, 3d, 1w) and the charts are shown for this duration.
Scenario: As a registered user, I should be able to verify that user-defined quotas are greater than the current usage, the field is highlighted in green
Scenario: As a registered user, I should be not be able to create new slice without the Slice Bandwidth guaranteed..
Scenario: As a registered user, I should be able to verify the namespace sameness being activated when namespace sameness is turned on via toggle button.
Scenario: As a registered user, I should be able to verify the visibility of cluster data table including `Clusters`, `Deployment Location` and `Cloud Type` in the collapsable dropdown table.
Scenario: As registered administrator, I should be able to log in successfully
Scenario: As registered administrator, I should be able to see About Us information: Version
Scenario: As a registered user, I should be able to verify that the usage shows in red/green based on whether they are less than/more than the usage
Scenario: As a user, I should be able to view the node capacity under Topology > Nodes
Scenario: As a registered user, I should be able to verify the visibility of Namespace popup modal and the data inside the modal

Scenario: As a user, I should be able to verify the visibility  of slice selection field, `Topology view` toggle button, cluster selection field, graph type selection (line or area) field and graph time selection (1hr, 3hrs, 5hrs, 1d, 3d, 1w).
Scenario: As a registered user, I should be able to verify that the slice name and the dials are shown with the usage and quotas at the slice level
Scenario: As a registered user, I should be able to validate the avaibility of the refresh and delete button.
Scenario: As a registered user, I should be able to see the list of slices under Connect > Slices and slice absent message if we don't have any slices
Scenario: As a user, I should be able to verify that the user can navigate out of this page.
Scenario: As a registered user, I should be able to verify the visibility of “Code Preview” section along with the utility icons on the far right header of “Code Preview” and its utilities.
Scenario: As a registered user, I should be able to verify the visibility of cluster data table including `Clusters`, `Deployment Location` and `Cloud Type` in the collapsable dropdown table.
Scenario: As a registered user, I should be able to view cluster details table when cluster is present and no cluster message when in initial register cluster screen when no cluster present.
Scenario: As a user, I should be able to view deployment map, metrics, clusters, slices, nodes and service dependency graph in dashboard.

Scenario: As a registered user, I should be able to verify that Slice Admin can remove enforcement from certain/all namespaces by turning the toggle off and that this will also delete any quotas set for the namespace.

Scenario: As a registered user, I should be able to verify the `Search` input field according to `Namespaces` or `Cluster name` and `Add Allowed Namespaces` button and `Selected Namespaces` field along with `No namespaces selected` message in the selected namespace field if no namespaces are selected.
